data.title: starrer Nunakuzhi Promises An Out
data.meta_description: The film stars actors Basil Joseph and Grace Antony in lead roles.
data.text:
The film Nunakuzhi, directed by Jeethu Joseph and starring Basil Joseph, is all set to hit the theatres on August 15. Following the massive success of Drishyam 2, whose story was written by Jeethu Joseph, this film has already created a buzz among the audience. The trailer was released by the makers yesterday, August 7. It was widely shared on the internet. The trailer suggests that Nunakuzhi will be an out-and-out comedy and family entertainer. The teaser and a song were released last week which are still trending on YouTube. The film stars actors Basil Joseph and Grace Antony in lead roles, who are known for their effortless portrayal of humorous characters. The film is set against the backdrop of a family. Nunakuzhi will also feature well-known actors like Siddique, Manoj K Jayan and Baiju Santhosh in prominent roles.

The script of Nunakuzhi is penned by KR Krishna Kumar. The film is produced by Vikram Mehra and Siddharth Anand Kumar while it is co-produced by Sahil S Sharma. It is set to be distributed under the banner of Aashirvad Cinemas. Other prominent celebrities who are set to play prominent roles are Nikhila Vimal, Shyam Mohan, Swasika Vijay, Aju Varghese, Saiju Kurup, Althaf Salim, Azees Nedumangad, Binu Pappu, Dinesh Prabhakar, Rajesh Paravoor, Santhosh Lakshman, Riyas Marimayam, Shyam Thrukkunnappuzha and Kalabhavan Yusuf.

The cinematography department was handled by Satheesh Kurup while the film was edited by VS Vinayak. The music is composed by Vishnu Shyam. The trailer went viral on various social media platforms.

Jeethu Joseph is presently working on several films. Presently, the director is busy with the promotional events of the film. Some of his upcoming works are Drishyam 3 and Ram. Drishyam 3 is set to star actors like Ajay Devgn, Tabu, Rajat Kapoor, Ishita Dutta and Saurabh Shukla in prominent roles. The other details are yet to be announced by the makers.
